If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

entities.name: Roc
entities.description: *Gargantuan monstrosity, unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 20 ft., fly 120 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: passive Perception 14

Features and Traits.Name: Keen Sight.
Features and Traits.Description: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

Features and Traits.Name: Beak.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Talons.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can’t use its talons on another target.

entities.name: Roper
entities.description: *Large monstrosity, neutral evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 10 ft., climb 10 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 16

Features and Traits.Name: False Appearance.
Features and Traits.Description: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

Features and Traits.Name: Grasping Tendrils.
Features and Traits.Description: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

Features and Traits.Name: Spider Climb.
Features and Traits.Description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Tendril.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can’t use the same tendril on another target.

Features and Traits.Name: Reel.
Features and Traits.Description: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

entities.name: Rust Monster
entities.description: *Medium monstrosity, unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11

Features and Traits.Name: Iron Scent.
Features and Traits.Description: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

Features and Traits.Name: Rust Metal.
Features and Traits.Description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Antennae.
Features and Traits.Description: The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn’t being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster’s touch. If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

entities.name: Sahuagin
entities.description: *Medium humanoid (sahuagin), lawful evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft., swim 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Sahuagin

Features and Traits.Name: Blood Frenzy.
Features and Traits.Description: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hit points.

Features and Traits.Name: Limited Amphibiousness.
Features and Traits.Description: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

Features and Traits.Name: Shark Telepathy.
Features and Traits.Description: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Claws.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Spear.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entities.name: Salamander
entities.description: *Large elemental, neutral evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: cold

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: fire

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Ignan

Features and Traits.Name: Heated Body.
Features and Traits.Description: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Heated Weapons.
Features and Traits.Description: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

Features and Traits.Name: Spear.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Tail.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can’t make tail attacks against other targets.

entities.name: Satyr
entities.description: *Medium fey, chaotic neutral*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: passive Perception 12

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Common, Elvish, Sylvan

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Resistance.
Features and Traits.Description: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Features and Traits.Name: Ram.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Shortsword.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Shortbow.
Features and Traits.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entities.name: Shadow
entities.description: *Medium undead, chaotic evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: radiant

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: necrotic, poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Amorphous.
Features and Traits.Description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Features and Traits.Name: Shadow Stealth.
Features and Traits.Description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Features and Traits.Name: Sunlight Weakness.
Features and Traits.Description: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Features and Traits.Name: Strength Drain.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target’s Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

entities.name: Shambling Mound
entities.description: *Large plant, unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 20 ft., swim 20 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: cold, fire

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: lightning

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: blinded, deafened, exhaustion

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Lightning Absorption
Features and Traits.Description: . Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

Features and Traits.Name: Slam.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Engulf.
Features and Traits.Description: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound’s turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

entities.name: Shield Guardian
entities.description: *Large construct, unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: understands commands given in any language but can’t speak

Features and Traits.Name: Bound.
Features and Traits.Description: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet’s wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet’s wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

Features and Traits.Name: Regeneration.
Features and Traits.Description: The shield guardian regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

Features and Traits.Name: Spell Storing
Features and Traits.Description: . A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian’s amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

Features and Traits.Name: Fist.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Shield.
Features and Traits.Description: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian’s amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

entities.name: Skeleton
entities.description: *Medium undead, lawful evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: understands all languages it knew in life but can’t speak

Features and Traits.Name: Shortsword.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Shortbow.
Features and Traits.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entities.name: Minotaur Skeleton
entities.description: *Large undead, lawful evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: understands Abyssal but can’t speak

Features and Traits.Name: Charge.
Features and Traits.Description: If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

Features and Traits.Name: Greataxe.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Gore.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entities.name: Warhorse Skeleton
entities.description: *Large undead, lawful evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9

Features and Traits.Name: Hooves.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entities.name: Specter
entities.description: *Medium undead, chaotic evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 0 ft., fly 50 ft. (hover)

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: necrotic, poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: understands all languages it knew in life but can’t speak

Features and Traits.Name: Incorporeal Movement.
Features and Traits.Description: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Features and Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
Features and Traits.Description: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Features and Traits.Name: Life Drain.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entities.name: Androsphinx
entities.description: *Large monstrosity, lawful neutral*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft., fly 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, frightened

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: truesight 120 ft., passive Perception 20

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Common, Sphinx

Features and Traits.Name: Inscrutable.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Weapons.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx’s weapon attacks are magical.

Features and Traits.Name: Spellcasting.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following cleric spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy 1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, detect magic 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, zone of truth 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, tongues 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, greater restoration 6th level (1 slot): heroes’ feast

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Roar (3/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. Each creature within 500 feet of the sphinx and able to hear the roar must make a saving throw.

Features and Traits.Name: First Roar.
Features and Traits.Description: Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Features and Traits.Name: Second Roar.
Features and Traits.Description: Each creature that fails a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Features and Traits.Name: Third Roar.
Features and Traits.Description: Each creature makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone. Legendary! The sphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw Attack.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx makes one claw attack.

Features and Traits.Name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Features and Traits.Name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

entities.name: Gynosphinx
entities.description: *Large monstrosity, lawful neutral*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft., fly 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: psychic

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, frightened

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: truesight 120 ft., passive Perception 18

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Common, Sphinx

Features and Traits.Name: Inscrutable.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Weapons.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx’s weapon attacks are magical.

Features and Traits.Name: Spellcasting.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, shield 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, locate object, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, remove curse, tongues 4th level (3 slots): banishment, greater invisibility 5th level (1 slot): legend lore

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage. Legendary! The sphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw Attack.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx makes one claw attack.

Features and Traits.Name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Features and Traits.Name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The sphinx casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

entities.name: Sprite
entities.description: *Tiny fey, neutral good*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 10 ft., fly 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: passive Perception 13

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Common, Elvish, Sylvan

Features and Traits.Name: Longsword.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Shortbow.
Features and Traits.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Features and Traits.Name: Heart Sight.
Features and Traits.Description: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature’s current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 10 Charisma saving throw, the sprite also knows the creature’s alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

Features and Traits.Name: Invisibility.
Features and Traits.Description: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

entities.name: Stirge
entities.description: *Tiny beast, unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 10 ft., fly 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9

Features and Traits.Name: Blood Drain.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn’t attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge’s turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss. The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

entities.name: Succubus/Incubus
entities.description: *Medium fiend (shapechanger), neutral evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft., fly 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: cold, fire, lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Abyssal, Common, Infernal, telepathy 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Telepathic Bond.
Features and Traits.Description: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don’t even need to be on the same plane of existence.

Features and Traits.Name: Shapechanger.
Features and Traits.Description: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw (Fiend Form Only).
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Charm.
Features and Traits.Description: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend’s verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend’s Charm for the next 24 hours. The fiend can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

Features and Traits.Name: Draining Kiss.
Features and Traits.Description: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Features and Traits.Name: Etherealness.
Features and Traits.Description: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

entities.name: Tarrasque
entities.description: *Gargantuan monstrosity (titan), unaligned*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 40 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: blindsight 120 ft., passive Perception 10

Features and Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Resistance.
Features and Traits.Description: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Features and Traits.Name: Reflective Carapace.
Features and Traits.Description: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

Features and Traits.Name: Siege Monster.
Features and Traits.Description: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can’t bite another target.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Horns.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Tail.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Features and Traits.Name: Frightful Presence.
Features and Traits.Description: Each creature of the tarrasque’s choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Features and Traits.Name: Swallow.
Features and Traits.Description: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite’s damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque’s turns. If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone. Legendary! The tarrasque can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The tarrasque regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Attack.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

Features and Traits.Name: Move.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

Features and Traits.Name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

entities.name: Treant
entities.description: *Huge plant, chaotic good*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: bludgeoning, piercing

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Vulnerabilities
Features and Traits.Description: fire

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: passive Perception 13

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Common, Druidic, Elvish, Sylvan

Features and Traits.Name: False Appearance.
Features and Traits.Description: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

Features and Traits.Name: Siege Monster.
Features and Traits.Description: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The treant makes two slam attacks.

Features and Traits.Name: Slam.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Rock.
Features and Traits.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Animate Trees (1/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can’t speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

entities.name: Troll
entities.description: *Large giant, chaotic evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Giant

Features and Traits.Name: Keen Smell.
Features and Traits.Description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Features and Traits.Name: Regeneration.
Features and Traits.Description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the troll’s next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Claw.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entities.name: Unicorn
entities.description: *Large celestial**,** lawful good*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 50 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, paralyzed, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: Celestial, Elvish, Sylvan, telepathy 60 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Charge.
Features and Traits.Description: If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Features and Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting.
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace 1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

Features and Traits.name: Calm Emotions
Features and Traits.description: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.You can suppress any effect causing a target to be charmed or frightened. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the GM rules otherwise.

Features and Traits.name: Detect Evil and Good
Features and Traits.description: For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Features and Traits.name: Dispel Evil and Good
Features and Traits.description: Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from fey, undead, and creatures originating from beyond the Material Plane. For the duration, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.***Break Enchantment.*** As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is charmed, frightened, or possessed by a celestial, an elemental, a fey, a fiend, or an undead. The creature you touch is no longer charmed, frightened, or possessed by such creatures.***Dismissal.*** As your action, make a melee spell attack against a celestial, an elemental, a fey, a fiend, or an undead you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn’t there already). If they aren’t on their home plane, undead are sent to the Shadowfell, and fey are sent to the Feywild.

Features and Traits.name: Entangle
Features and Traits.description: Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

Features and Traits.name: Pass without Trace
Features and Traits.description: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can’t be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Resistance.
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Features and Traits.Name: Magic Weapons.
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn’s weapon attacks are magical.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

Features and Traits.Name: Hooves.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Horn.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Healing Touch (3/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

Features and Traits.Name: Teleport (1/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: The unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away. Legendary! The unicorn can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The unicorn regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Hooves.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The unicorn makes one attack with its hooves.

Features and Traits.Name: Shimmering Shield (Costs 2 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The unicorn creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the unicorn’s next turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The unicorn magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

entities.name: Vampire
entities.description: *Medium undead (shapechanger), lawful evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 17

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: the languages it knew in life

Features and Traits.Name: Shapechanger.
Features and Traits.Description: If the vampire isn’t in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in bat form, the vampire can’t speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies. While in mist form, the vampire can’t take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can’t pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

Features and Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Features and Traits.Name: Misty Escape.
Features and Traits.Description: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn’t in sunlight or running water. If it can’t transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can’t revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

Features and Traits.Name: Regeneration.
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Spider Climb.
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Features and Traits.Name: Vampire Weaknesses.
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire has the following flaws: Forbiddance. The vampire can’t enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water. Stake to the Heart. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire’s heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed. Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only).
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

Features and Traits.Name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only).
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 18).

Features and Traits.Name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only).
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire’s control.

Features and Traits.Name: Charm.
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn’t under the vampire’s control, it takes the vampire’s requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire’s bite attack. Each time the vampire or the vampire’s companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

Features and Traits.Name: Children of the Night (1/Day).
Features and Traits.Description: The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn’t up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action. Legendary! The vampire can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The vampire regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Features and Traits.Name: Move.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Features and Traits.Name: Unarmed Strike.
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The vampire makes one unarmed strike.

Features and Traits.Name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions).
Features and Traits.Description: Legendary! The vampire makes one bite attack.

entities.name: Wight
entities.description: *Medium undead, neutral evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 30 ft.

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren’t silvered

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, poisoned

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: the languages it knew in life

Features and Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
Features and Traits.Description: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Features and Traits.Name: Multiattack.
Features and Traits.Description: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

Features and Traits.Name: Life Drain.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight’s control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

Features and Traits.Name: Longsword.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Features and Traits.Name: Longbow.
Features and Traits.Description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entities.name: Will-o’-Wisp
entities.description: *Tiny undead, chaotic evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 0 ft., fly 50 ft. (hover)

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: lightning, poison

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 12

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: the languages it knew in life

Features and Traits.Name: Consume Life.
Features and Traits.Description: As a bonus action, the will-o’-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o’-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

Features and Traits.Name: Ephemeral.
Features and Traits.Description: The will-o’-wisp can’t wear or carry anything.

Features and Traits.Name: Incorporeal Movement.
Features and Traits.Description: The will-o’-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Features and Traits.Name: Variable Illumination.
Features and Traits.Description: The will-o’-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o’-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

Features and Traits.Name: Shock.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

Features and Traits.Name: Invisibility.
Features and Traits.Description: The will-o’-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entities.name: Wraith
entities.description: *Medium undead, neutral evil*

Features and Traits.Name: Speed
Features and Traits.Description: 0 ft., fly 60 ft. (hover)

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Resistances
Features and Traits.Description: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren’t silvered

Features and Traits.Name: Damage Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: necrotic, poison

Features and Traits.Name: Condition Immunities
Features and Traits.Description: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

Features and Traits.Name: Senses
Features and Traits.Description: darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

Features and Traits.Name: Languages
Features and Traits.Description: the languages it knew in life

Features and Traits.Name: Incorporeal Movement.
Features and Traits.Description: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Features and Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
Features and Traits.Description: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Features and Traits.Name: Life Drain.
Features and Traits.Description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Features and Traits.Name: Create Specter.
Features and Traits.Description: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target’s spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith’s control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.
